resources.string: "HALMAL DANDIYA"

Scientific name :- Rasboroides vaterifloris

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Golden Rasbora
  • Sinhala name :- Halmal dandiya, Halmal thiththaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
    Global (2018): NE

• Location :- Found in Kelani and Kalu river
  • Environment :- Found in shallow, cool, clear, shady pools in fast flowing streams
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 2.8cm
  • Identification features :-
    Females are in lighter color

    Have different color forms

    This species can be overlapping with Rasboroides pallidus
  • Other :- N/A
"LE THITHTHAYA"

Scientific name :- Puntius titteyal

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Cherry Barb/li>
  • Sinhala name :- Le thiththaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
    Global (2018): LC

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in Heavily shaded, shallow, slow-flowing waters with silty and leaf-debris substrates
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 2.5-3.5 cm
  • Identification features :-
    Females are in lighter color

    Have different color formss
  • Other :- N/A
"BULATH HAPAYA"

Scientific name :- Pethia nigrofasciata

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Black Ruby Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Bulath hapaya, Manamaalaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
    Global (2018): NE

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins and tributes in Walawe river
  • Environment :- Found in Clear, cool shaded stream waters with sandy or gravel substrate
  • Maximum length :-Can be grow up to 5.25 cm
  • Identification features :-
    Females are lack in red color

    Have different color forms
  • Other :- N/A
"DEPULLIYA"

Scientific name :- Pethiya cumingii

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Cuming\'s Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Depulliya, Pothaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
    Global (2018): NE

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in clear, shallow, slow flowing, shaded streams with mud or silt substrates
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 5cm
  • Identification features :- N/A
  • Other :-
    Females are in lighter color

    This species can be overlapping with Pethiya reval
"PATHIRANA SAALAYA"

Scientific name :- Devario pathirana

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Barred Danio
  • Sinhala name :- Pathirana saalaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
    Global (2018): EN

• Location :- Found in Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Occurs in pools and in swift-flowing areas of streams with a pebble or boulder substrate frequenting near-surface waters
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 6cm
  • Other :- This species can be overlapping with Devario malabaricus
"THALKOSSA"

Scientific name :- Belontia signata

\n
  • Family :- Belontidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Combtail
  • Sinhala name :- Thalkossa, Pulutta, Kola moda
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): NT
    Global (2018): LC

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins and mid-hill region of the Mahaweli river basin
  • Environment :- Found in shaded margins of slow flowing, shallow clear streams with pebble or sand substrates
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 10cm
  • Other :-
    Females are in lighter color with shorter filaments on fins

    Juveniles have dark brown/black spot on posterior end of the base of caudal fin and elongated rays are absent in caudal fin

    Have different color forms
"MAGURA"

Scientific name :- Clarias brachysoma

\n
  • Family :- Claridae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Walking Catfish
  • Sinhala name :-Magura,Vel magura
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): NT
    Global (2018): NE

• Location :- Distributed throughout Sri Lanka (not in very high elevations)
  • Environment :- Can be found in clear flowing streams as well as muddy waters
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 47cm
  • Other :- No sexual differences
"BATAKOLA THELIYA"

Scientific name :- Macrognathus pentophthalmos

\n
  • Family :- Mastacembelidae
  • English name :- Mastacembelidae
  • Sinhala name :- Batakola Theliya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
    Global (2018): NE

• Location :- Could be extinct
  • Environment :- N/A
  • Maximum length :- N/A
  • Other :- N/A
